sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT copy (option*, source+, destination)> <!ATTLIST copy base CDATA #IMPLIED>
sect2.para: This element occurs in the elements alfs, else, stage. and then

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The element copy is used to copy one or several source files and/or directories into a destination file or directory

The supported options are options of the cp command:
archive
force
no-dereference
preserve
recursive .
When processing this element, one copy each source to the destination, using the specified options.
When the attribute base is specified, it should contain the name of the current directory from which the copy operation is performed.

sect2.title: Examples
sect2.programlisting: echo Copying ' config.txt into /opt/mypackage/config.txt' cd /usr/src/mypackage cp -f config.txt /opt/mypackage/config.txt
